Quick glimpse

Geodecisions drives your making decision processes relying on several GIS systems under the hood.

Geodecisions is aimed to help a wide spectrum of users, from single users to big enterprises in all kind of decisions in which geographic information could be a factor.

Decision processes

The main unit of interaction for a Geodecisions user is the Decision process or just process, what is, summarizing a lot, the fact of make a decision.

One process is populated with one or more decision factor during their inception and after.

Additionally, every process has one or more tags, which allow users get informed about similar processes.

As coolest feature, is the decisions stream of the process, which is a stream of related and relevant information for the process, based in the process carried out by the whole community.

Decision factors

Geodecisions is built on top of the concept of decision factor. A decision factor is what moves a person to select one option over another one.

Every decision factor in Geodecisions has several sources of geographic information which will help users during their process of make a decision.

Evolving in order to support more and more decision factors is a continuously task for the Geodecisions team.

Decisions stream

Geodecisions gives every user a stream of decisions which are being taken or which has been taken before, using the tags subsystem.

This means that by default, some information of every decision process is share with the whole community, but no private information is share without explicit approval of the user.
